bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Eleanor Lappage to Philip Showalter Hench, January 8, 1952

div1.p: Lappage requests that Hench edit the final draft of his speech and mail it to her.

div1.head: Telegram from Eleanor Lappage to Philip Showalter Hench, January 8, 1952
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDEN
CLASS OF SERVICE
----
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
1201
___________________________(40)..__________________________
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of eciept is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MA266 NSA250
NS.BMA693 PD=BIRMINGHAM ALA 8 329P=
1952 JAN 8 PM 3 51
P S HENCH= :MAYO CLINIC ROCHESTER MINN=
div1.p:
IT WOULD BE MOST HELPFUL TO EDIT AND MAIL SPEECH IN FINAL
FORM TO ME IN BIRMINGHAM AT YOUR CONVENIENCE=
div1.closer: :ELEANOR LAPPAGE SECRETARY= THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
